issue.title: Clean up rules for op.gg
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

OP.GG changed their domain handling a while ago. Specifically, they unified all domains to op.gg by removing subdomains, even for tracker sites for titles other than League of Legends, such as tft.op.gg. As a result, the rules with subdomains included in the filter are not working.

www.op.gg
tft.op.gg
na.op.gg
valorant.op.gg
overwatch.op.gg


### Proposed solution

I think the rules with subdomains should be fixed. Also, I think it's necessary to remove any rules that are now outdated.

### Additional information

_No response_

issue.title: Move Azerbaĳani/Azeri entries from AdGuard Base Foreign to AdGuard Turkish
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Though it's been some years now since I last proposed the idea (#89227), I figured it was worth revisiting, in part as it'd make it somewhat viable for uBO to add `az` to their list of ISO codes that have regional lists auto-assigned to new extension installations by default.

### Proposed solution

Move the following 409 entries from https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/BaseFilter/sections/foreign.txt to various subfolders in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/tree/master/TurkishFilter/sections:

comment.body:
It seems to only show up with the param: campaign. Removing it appears to solve the problem
``||gettranny.com^$removeparam=campaign``

this should also work ``gettranny.com#%#//scriptlet('abort-current-inline-script', '_campControl')``

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

But I don't know exactly which rule is causing the problem
